conclusion: A and B are moving towards each other in the same direction, and the task is to determine their final positions based on power, collision, and deflection effects.
Image 1 shows A (purple car) and B (green car) moving towards each other from opposite sides of the frame, with cubes and ball stationary.

Image 2 shows A and B colliding near the center of the frame, deflected off their original paths. A moves slightly to the right and interacts with the yellow cube, while B is pushed upwards into the purple and red cubes.

Image 3 shows A coming to rest near the upper left quadrant after deflection by the yellow cube, and B stopping near the top center after interacting with the purple and red cubes. The cubes and ball are slightly displaced.
The initial kinetic energy of A and B was sufficient for them to collide and cause deflection.
The collision deflected A and B towards stationary objects (cubes).
A hitting the yellow cube caused a change in direction, moving it away from the initial collision point.
B was deflected upward by the purple and red cubes, altering its path away from the initial collision site.
After interactions with the cubes, both cars lost enough kinetic energy to come to a stop.
A stopped near the upper left quadrant, close to the yellow cube.
B stopped near the top center of the frame, after being deflected by the purple and red cubes.
Final positions: A near the upper left quadrant close to the yellow cube, and B near the top center after deflection by the purple and red cubes.
